metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: To output values or print text in C#, you can use the WriteLine() method:
content.html: To output values or print text in C#, you can use the WriteLine() method:

content.code_html: Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");

content.text: You can add as many WriteLine() methods as you want. Note that it will add a new line for each method:
content.html: You can add as many WriteLine() methods as you want. Note that it will add a new line for each method:

content.code:
Console
.
WriteLine
(
"Hello World!"
)
;

Console
.
WriteLine
(
"I am Learning C#"
)
;

Console
.
WriteLine
(
"It is awesome!"
)
;
content.code_html:
Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");
Console.WriteLine("I am Learning C#");
Console.WriteLine("It is awesome!");

content.text: You can also output numbers, and perform mathematical calculations:
content.html: You can also output numbers, and perform mathematical calculations:

content.code_html: Console.WriteLine(3 + 3);

content.text: There is also a Write() method, which is similar to WriteLine() .
content.html: There is also a Write() method, which is similar to WriteLine().

content.text: The only difference is that it does not insert a new line at the end of the output:
content.html: The only difference is that it does not insert a new line at the end of the output:

content.code:
Console
.
Write
(
"Hello World! "
)
;

Console
.
Write
(
"I will print on the same line."
)
;
content.code_html:
Console.Write("Hello World! ");
Console.Write("I will print on the same line.");

content.text: Note that we add an extra space when needed (after "Hello World!" in the example above), for better readability.
content.html: Note that we add an extra space when needed (after "Hello World!" in the example above), for better readability.

content.text: In this tutorial, we will only use WriteLine() as it makes it easier to read the output of code.
content.html: In this tutorial, we will only use WriteLine() as it makes it easier to read the output of code.
